items.description: River Wandle area in the London Boroughs of Wandsworth, Merton, Lambeth, Croydon and Sutton
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Croydon, Greater London, Lambeth, Merton, Sutton, Wandsworth

items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.
There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away.
Further rainfall is forecast tomorrow but no further flooding is expected.
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

items.description: Wyke Beck and Meanwood Beck catchments
items.message:
River levels in Wyke Beck have responded rapidly as a result of heavy localised rainfall, potentially generating deep, fast flows. Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.
We are closely monitoring the situation.
This message will be updated by 20:00 20/07/2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Wash Dike catchment
items.message:
Levels in Wash Dike have responded rapidly as a result of heavy localised rainfall.  Water levels could rise rapidly and potentially generate deep, fast flows. We could also see some surface water impacts, particularly in urban areas that experience the most intense bursts of rain.
We are closely monitoring the situation.
Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.
This message will be updated by 20:00 this evening 20/07/2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Car Brook catchment
items.message:
Levels on Carr Brook have fallen and are no longer a cause for concern. Further showers are expected over the next few days so we will continue to monitor the situation.
Surface water following today's rainfall may affect low spots on roads. Please avoid walking or driving through flood water, which can contain hidden hazards.
